attributes.action: Keep pools & fitness facilities operating to help protect health of the nation.
attributes.additional_details: The toll of a second national lockdown in England through November and beyond will have significant impact on the mental health and physical well-being of the British public. These businesses implement strict Covid-controls and evidence shows that they have been operating safely since July.  The benefits will be far and wide reaching for those who depend on access to fitness facilities to improve, manage or prevent Physical and mental illnesses and injuries. There will be an economic benefit too
attributes.background: Allow pools, gyms, fitness centres/classes to operate through lockdown to protect the mental and physical health and wellbeing of the nation and alleviate the inevitable additional burden on NHS Resources

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Keep gyms and leisure facilities open during any lockdown: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556956

Prevent gyms closing due to a spike in Covid 19 cases: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333869

The Committee will be holding a debate on Covid-19 restrictions on gyms and sport on Monday 23 November. You will be able to watch the debate on Parliament TV at 4.30pm: https://www.parliamentlive.tv/Commons
